Cat 1 (album)

\n\t
\n\t\t
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
\n\t\t
\n\t\t
\n\t\t\n\t\t
\n\t\tJump to navigation\n\t\tJump to search\n\t\t
The correct title of this article is Cat #1. The omission of the # is due to technical restrictions.
\n
This article does not cite any sources. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.
Find sources: "Cat 1" album \xe2\x80\x93 news \xc2\xb7 newspapers \xc2\xb7 books \xc2\xb7 scholar \xc2\xb7 JSTOR (June 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
\n
1994 studio album by Criss
Cat #1
Studio album by
Criss
ReleasedAugust 16, 1994
RecordedTrack Records and Cherokee Studios, Los Angeles, California
GenreRock, hard rock
Length46:37
LabelTony Nicole Tony Records
ProducerDito Godwin, Peter Criss, Mark Montague
Criss chronology
\n\n\n\n\n\n
Let Me Rock You
(1982)\n		Cat #1
(1994)\n		One for All
(2007)\n
\n

Cat #1 is the fourth solo studio album released by former Kiss drummer Peter Criss, and first under the band name Criss. Criss re-recorded the Kiss song "Beth" for the album. Unlike the orchestrated original version, the new recording was an acoustic version. The album also features former-Kiss bandmate Ace Frehley playing guitar on three tracks.\n

In 1993, Criss released a special limited edition preview EP compact disc for the forthcoming album. Three tracks were released on the 1994 CD and two tracks were only available on the limited edition CD. The album was re-released on colored vinyl in 2019 and included the two tracks from the limited edition CD. A CD single was released in Europe in 1998 which included three tracks from the album, including "Beth." A promotional video was produced for "Show Me," which was aired on MTV. The album did not chart in any territory. \n

For the cover art, it was Criss\' idea to paint half of his face in his original Kiss makeup, while leaving the other half plain. The idea was to link past and present.\n

Track listing[edit]

\n
  1. "Bad Attitude" (Peter Criss, Mark Montague, Carrion) \xe2\x80\x93 4:33
    2. \n
  2. "Walk the Line" (Criss, Montague) \xe2\x80\x93 3:47
    3. \n
  3. "The Truth" (Montague, Criss, Tosetti) \xe2\x80\x93 4:53
    4. \n
  4. "Bad People Burn in Hell" (Criss, Naro) \xe2\x80\x93 3:46
    5. \n
  5. "Show Me" (Montague, Mike Stone, Criss, Bardowell) \xe2\x80\x93 4:03
    6. \n
  6. "Good Times" (Criss, Kirk Miller, Montague) \xe2\x80\x93 4:37
    7. \n
  7. "Strike" (Criss, Montague) \xe2\x80\x93 4:45
    8. \n
  8. "Blue Moon over Brooklyn" (Criss, Naro) \xe2\x80\x93 5:22
    9. \n
  9. "Down With the Sun" (Criss, Montague) \xe2\x80\x93 4:37
    10. \n
  10. "We Want You" (Carrion, Montague) \xe2\x80\x93 3:47
    11. \n
  11. "Beth" (Criss, Stan Penridge, Bob Ezrin) \xe2\x80\x93 2:27
\n

Limited Edition tracks\n

\n
  1. "The Cat" (Criss/Montague/Miller/Stone) - 4:36
    2. \n
  2. "Show Me"
    3. \n
  3. "Good Times"
    4. \n
  4. "What You\'re Doin\'" (Criss/Montague/Stone/Miller) - 3:09
    5. \n
  5. "Beth"
\n

Credits[edit]

\n

Band[edit]

\n
  • Peter Criss \xe2\x80\x93 lead vocals, drums, percussion
    • \n
  • Mark Montague \xe2\x80\x93 bass guitar, backing vocals, vocals on tracks 7 and 10.
    • \n
  • Mike Stone \xe2\x80\x93 rhythm guitar, Vocals on track 5.
    • \n
  • Mike McLaughlin \xe2\x80\x93 lead guitar
\n

Guest musicians[edit]

\n
  • Ace Frehley \xe2\x80\x93 lead guitar on "Bad Attitude", "Walk the Line" and "Blue Moon over Brooklyn"
    • \n
  • Wayne Johnsen \xe2\x80\x93 acoustic guitar on "Beth"
    • \n
  • Kirk Miller \xe2\x80\x93 guitar
    • \n
  • Dito Godwin \xe2\x80\x93 piano on "Blue Moon over Brooklyn", slide guitar on "The Cat", backing vocals
    • \n
  • Doug Shawe \xe2\x80\x93 piano
    • \n
  • Stephen Presley \xe2\x80\x93 keyboards
    • \n
  • Ed Kanon \xe2\x80\x93 cymbals
